snippet: Three books take different approaches to the subject of tennis, but all genuflect to both Roger Federer and David Foster Wallace.
abstract: Jay Jennings reviews books Love Game: A History of Tennis, From Victorian Pastime to Global Phenomenon by Elizabeth Wilson, Late to the Ball: Age. Learn. Fight. Love. Play Tennis. Win. by Gerald Marzorati and Federer and Me: A Story of Obsession by William Skidelsky.
lead_paragraph: Three books take different approaches to the subject of tennis, but all genuflect to both Roger Federer and David Foster Wallace.

headline.main: ‘Love Game,’ ‘Late to the Ball’ and ‘Federer and Me’
